meanings.definition: The act of surrounding or enclosing something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The encirclement of the garden by a fence kept the rabbits out.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers planned an encirclement of the enemy camp to trap them.
meanings.sent3: The encirclement of the birthday cake by eager children was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The encirclement of stars in the night sky filled her with wonder.
meanings.sent5: The encirclement of the town by mountains made it feel isolated and protected.

meanings.definition: The state of being surrounded on all sides.
meanings.sent1: The castle's encirclement by a moat made it difficult to attack.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of claustrophobia due to the encirclement of the crowded room.
meanings.sent3: The encirclement of the cookie jar by mischievous kids led to a hilarious chase.
meanings.sent4: His loneliness was like an encirclement of darkness that he couldn't escape.
meanings.sent5: The encirclement of the island by crystal-clear waters created a stunning view.
